strings.Value: Gifted masters are a jack of all trades. In the truest sense of the word. They are versatile and can do almost anything.
Gifted masters are a jack of all trades.
Gifted masters are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus almost all bladed weapons. They are proficient with light armor, but not with shields.
Gifted masters are familiar with bladed weapons such as rapiers, short swords, long swords, dueling swords, scimitars, falcatas, kukris, and estocs.
At 4th level, and every 4 levels after, a Gifted Master gains the {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}Skill{/g} Focus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.

When a gifted master gains {g|Encyclopedia:XP}experience{/g}, he learns a number of new abilities. The gifted master gains a new ability at level 1, level 2, and after every four additional levels. An ability cannot be selected more than once.

At 1st level, a gifted master gains Weapon Finesse as a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}. In addition, starting at 3rd level, she can select any one type of weapon that can be used with Weapon Finesse (such as rapiers or daggers). Once this choice is made, it cannot be changed. Whenever she makes a successful {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} with the selected weapon, she adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier instead of her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier to the {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage roll{/g}. If any effect would prevent the gifted master from adding her Strength modifier to the damage {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g}, she does not add her Dexterity modifier. The gifted master can select a second weapon at 7th level and a third at 11th level.

At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, the gifted master gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as teamwork feats. The gifted master must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus feat.
At 3rd level, the gifted master automatically grants her teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to her animal companion. The companion doesn't need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.

As a gifted master advances, they can choose unique {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} in addition to the regular {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}, empowering them in combat and making them more useful outside it.
Gifted masters are excellent with bladed weapons and are proficient in two-handed combat. They are familiar with almost all bladed weapons and usually wield a rapier and an estoc as second weapon.

Fallen masters are inquisitors or clerics whose faith has been disappointed. They search for orientation in the world and not infrequently go astray. Due to their evil disposition, they take advantage of their domain bond so that they can obtain spells from two domains.

The charlatan is a funny fellow who gets through life with a few tricks and a bit of magic. Only very rarely does a charlatan have to take up arms, in most cases he manages to wriggle out of trouble through illusion or persuasion.

By bending and sometimes even breaking the rules of magic, the charlatan learns to exploit gaps and exceptions in the laws of magic. Some of these exploits allow her to break down various forms of magic, adding their essence to her arcane reservoir. At 1st level and every 3 levels thereafter, the charlatan learns a new arcane exploit. A charlatan exploit cannot be selected more than once. Once a charlatan exploit has been selected, it cannot be changed. Most charlatan exploits require the charlatan to expend points from her arcane reservoir to function. Unless otherwise noted, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} for an charlatan exploit is equal to 10 + half the charlatan's level + the charlatan's {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
A magistra is a gifted witch, who is mostly grown in noble circles. Since witchcraft is usually not welcome there, she had to devote herself to deception, cunning and illusions to get through life.
Archery Masters know how to use all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g} as well as estoc, rapier, shortbow, and longbow. They are proficient with light armor, but not shields.
Blade masters are proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus almost all bladed weapons. They are proficient with light and medium armor, but not with shields.
